Kasus Korupsi Hibah KPUD Kota Bogor, Mar Hendro Mengaku Diminta Sisihkan 15 Persen dari Proyek
04 Nov 2019, 12:42 by Yedi Supriadi
BANDUNG, (PR).- Terdakwa hibah KPUD Kota Bogor Mar Hendro mengaku dirinya adalah pegawai negeri sipil yang bertugas di Satuan Polisi Pamong Praja (Satpol PP) Kota Bogor. Dan ternyata Mar Hendro itu di tempat kerjanya sedang mendapat sanksi berat dari atasannya. Namun oleh KPUD Kota Bogor diangkat menjadi Ketua Pokja dalam Debat Publik Calon Walikota Bogor.
Demikian hal tersebut terungkap dalam sidang Kasus Korupsi Dana Hibah KPUD Kota Bogor yang digelar di Pengadilan Tipikor Bandung, Senin 4 Noember 2019.
Hakim Asep Sumirat sempat menanyakan mengenai status Mar Hendro yang sedang dalam terkena sanksi malah diangkat menjadi Ketua Pokja di KPU Kota Bogor. “Apakah Kepala Satpol PP dengan pimpinan di KPUD Bogor mengetahui, anda sedang kena sanksi,” ujar Hakim Asep Ruhimat bertanya kepada terdakwa.
Mar Hendro menyatakan mengetahuinya dan kordinasi antar kedua pimpinan lembaga tersebut. “Semula saya diperbantukan di KPU terutama dalam membuat dokumen pengadaan barang dan jasa dala rangka Piwalkot Bogor tahun 2012 silam.
Namun belakangan malah Mar Hendro ditunjuk menjadi Ketua Pokja program debat publik calon walikota. Hakim menilai seharusnya KPUD Bogor tidak membawanya pada PNS yang sedang mendapat sanski.
Kemudian, Mar Hendro juga mengemukakan tentang adanya suruhan menyisihkan uang dari proyek sebesar 15% dari proyek. Hendro pun menyanggupinya sehingga terjadilah korupsi.
Seperti diketahui Pengadilan Tipikor Bandung sedang menyidangkan kasus korupsi dana hibah Pilkada di KPUD Kota Kota Bogor tahun 2018 senilai Rp470 juta. Dalam kasus tersebut dihadapkan dua terdakwa yakni Mar Hendro berperan sebagai Ketua Pokja Unit Layanan Pengadaan (ULP) barang dan jasa di KPU Kota Bogor. Dan satu lagi terdakwa Hari Astama, mantan bendahara KPU Kota Bogor, yang juga PNS dari Kementerian Dalam Negeri.Keduanya bekerjasama melakukan tindak pidana korupsi. Mereka juga membuat kwitansi fiktif dalam pengadaan buletin atau tabloid KPU serta debat publik para calon wali kota dan wakil wali kota Bogor. Akibatnya, negara dirugikan sekitar Rp470 juta.***

Corruption Case of Bogor City Election Commission Election, Mar Hendro Admits Requested to Set aside 15 Percent of Project
Nov 04 2019, 12:42 by Yedi Supriadi
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Bogor City Election Commission (KPUD) defendant Mar Hendro claimed he was a civil servant who served in the Bogor City Civil Service Police Unit (Satpol PP). And it turns out that Mar Hendro at his workplace is being severely sanctioned by his superiors. However, the Bogor City Election Commission was appointed as Chairman of the Working Group in the Bogor City Mayor Candidate Public Debate.
Thus it was revealed in the hearing of the Corruption Case of the Bogor City KPUD Grant Fund held at the Bandung Corruption Court, Monday 4 November 2019.
Judge Asep Sumirat asked about the status of Mar Hendro who was currently under sanctions and was even appointed as Chairman of the Working Group at the Bogor City KPU. "Does the Head of the Satpol PP and the leadership at the Bogor Election Commission know that you are being sanctioned," Judge Asep Ruhimat asked the defendant.
Mar Hendro said that he knew about it and the coordination between the two leaders of the institution. "At first I was seconded at the KPU, especially in making the procurement of goods and services documents in the framework of the Bogor Piwalkot in 2012.
But lately Mar Hendro was appointed chairman of the mayor's public debate program. The judge considered that the Bogor Regional Election Commission should not have brought it to civil servants who were receiving sanski.
Then, Mar Hendro also said that there was an order to set aside money from the project by 15% of the project. Hendro also agreed so that there was corruption.
As is known Bandung Corruption Court is hearing a case of corruption Pilkada grant funds in the City of Bogor City Election Commission in 2018 worth Rp470 million. In this case two defendants were confronted namely Mar Hendro who acted as the Chairperson of the goods and services Procurement Service Unit (ULP) in the Bogor City KPU. And one more defendant was Hari Astama, a former treasurer of the KPU of the City of Bogor, who was also a civil servant from the Ministry of the Interior. They also made fictitious receipts in the procurement of KPU bulletins or tabloids as well as public debates of prospective mayors and vice mayors of Bogor. As a result, the country suffered a loss of around Rp.470 million. ***
